title: Comics + Writing
description: I have been programming for 10 years and teaching classes on the same topic for just as long. My expertise lies within Web Development though I know the fundamentals of Python. I am currently teaching myself React.JS, Node.JS and other associated topics.

projects.title: Tropical Punch
projects.desc: It's a story as old as time. A boy and his dog. A boy and his dog go on a martial-arts road trip so the boy can fight his way back into an ancient clan of warriors. It's all boring, everyday affairs, really. Did I mention the dog was also the boy's chainsmoking teacher? Great stuff
projects.para2: Tropical Punch is an ongoing action/comedy series that began publication in June of 2022. It is drawn by Ryan Ibbotson and written, lettered and produced by myself. It is sold in comic shops around Ireland, online through Gumroad, and at conventions such as the Cork Zine Fest and the Dublin Comic and Arts Fair. It is currently published in individually printed and released issues with a forthcoming collection of the first 4 issues, standing at over 100 pages long. Tropical Punch has built a loyal and local fanbase in Cork City over the course of its run. In particular, each of the first 3 issues sold out upon release, and as a result in late 2022, the entire series was sent back to the printer for a re-printed second-edition run. This second edition publication has also continued to sell well and has ensured the series' longevity going forward.

projects.title: Marco The Demon Dude
projects.desc: What would you do if you got superpowers at 12? Well, when Marco makes a deal with a devil, he gets to find an answer to that question. Superhero. He becomes a superhero. Because of course, he does! If you've got the power to knock bad guys through buildings in your spandex-clad fingertips, why shouldn't you? Who cares about justice, morals or terrorized locals? All you've gotta do is beat the bad guy and Marco The Demon Dude will do whatever it takes... Even if that means blowing up a city in the process.
projects.para2: Marco The Demon Dude was a 4 chapter series that began publication in 2019 and finished serialization in 2022. It was ultimately collected into an 80+ page graphic novel which went on to win 4 Irish Comic News awards in 2022. Including but not limited to 'Overall Best Irish Comic' and allowed me to win 'Best Small Press Writer'. The book was then allowed me to be shortlisted for a Cork 'Rebel Spirit Award from MBC International and the series was featured in the 'Louder Than Words' Junior Cycle English Textbook as an example of Sequential Storytelling.

projects.title: Cork Teen Graphic Novel Project
projects.desc: The teen graphic novel project is an initiative set up by the Cork City Libraries. It offers teenagers the opportunity to begin making comic books in a professional setting with the guidance of editors and letterers. The program tasks writers and artists, pairs them up with each other and teaches them the ropes of how to produce a professional comic book that is printed and released in a public event. I participated from 2016-2018 as a writer and in 2019 and 2020 was brought on as a letterer and project co-ordinator.

projects.title: Saturday AM & Fan Art Fridays
projects.desc: Initially brought on to work as a talent acquisition assistant and as an editor for internationally published graphic novels and magazines, then to manage that editing team before finally transitioning into my role as the European Marketing Intern where I researched and focused on expanding the company’s outreach and brand awareness in Europe along with working with the global marketing team. As part of this initiative, I lead events and brokered partnership, namely a company appearance at Ireland’s largest Japanese culture conventions such as Akumakon and Kaizoku-Con.
projects.para2: Having worked well with the global team during my internship, I was brought onto the staff team to continue my work to bring our company to Europe. After showing my dedication and my ability to organise the production of such a project, I've been appointed to spearhead our newest digital magazine Fan Art Friday released and read on our app by the thousands of people who have downloaded it. Eventually, I transited from an Editor & Producer into a part-time role to ensure I could uphold the quality of my work while on placement for college.

title: Video Work
description: I have been programming for 10 years and teaching classes on the same topic for just as long. My expertise lies within Web Development though I know the fundamentals of Python. I am currently teaching myself React.JS, Node.JS and other associated topics.

projects.title: The Tiredness I Feel
projects.desc: In 2019, I conceptualized and produced a captivating 30-second video project titled 'The Tiredness I Feel.' This piece was a result of my creative endeavor during my time in college, where I took charge of shooting and editing the video. With a vision inspired by the neon and vaporwave aesthetics, I meticulously crafted a visually stunning experience that aimed to evoke a sense of exhaustion. Through careful composition, lighting, and post-production techniques, I immersed the viewer in a dreamlike world, rich in vibrant colors and nostalgic imagery. 'The Tiredness I Feel' served as a testament to my ability to effectively translate concepts into visually striking video content, capturing the essence of a specific mood and style. It stood as a reflection of my creativity and technical skills in videography and editing during that period.

projects.title: How The US Joined WW2 - Bill Wurtz Reanimation
projects.desc: I created a 30-second animation project that depicted the entry of the United States into World War II. This video was crafted to showcase the fundamental principles of animation, highlighting my proficiency in each aspect. From concept to completion, I took on the responsibility of creating and animating all the unique assets in the video.

projects.title: How Cameras Work
projects.desc: As part of a college assignment, I made a video to showcase the functions of DSLR and SLR cameras using only analog sources. In this visual piece, I immersed myself in a hands-on approach, capturing all the footage with my own camera and painstakingly creating hand-drawn animations on paper, which were then scanned in. By relying solely on analog techniques, I aimed to demonstrate my understanding of the fundamentals of photography and animation. This project challenged my creativity and technical skills, requiring me to think outside the box to effectively communicate the intricacies of camera functionality within a limited time frame. The resulting visual piece not only highlighted my dedication to craftsmanship but also showcased my ability to communicate complex concepts through innovative and artistic means.

projects.title: Freelance Video Editing Project
projects.desc: I undertook a freelance video editing project for the Craftsdwarf channel, where I had the opportunity to showcase my skills in video and audio editing, as well as create unique animations. With meticulous attention to detail, I seamlessly merged different video clips, ensuring a cohesive and engaging final product. Additionally, I enhanced the audio quality, optimizing it for a more immersive viewing experience. To elevate the visual appeal, I incorporated my own handcrafted animations, adding a touch of creativity and uniqueness to the project. Through this freelance endeavor, I demonstrated my versatility and expertise in video editing, while contributing to the visual and auditory excellence of Craftsdwarf's content.

title: Web Design
description: I have been programming for 10 years and teaching classes on the same topic for just as long. My expertise lies within Web Development though I know the fundamentals of Python. I am currently teaching myself React.JS, Node.JS and other associated topics.

projects.title: 2023 Portfolio Website
projects.desc: In 2023 I began to develop my portfolio website using React JS and various libraries like Framer Motion and Full Page JS. I initially designed the site's UI as a personal project while working for the Nimbus Research Institute. With a clear vision in mind, I aimed to create a site that showcased my diverse portfolio types. First and foremost, React JS served as the foundation of my website, enabling me to build a highly interactive and responsive user interface. Its component-based architecture facilitated modular development and enhanced code reusability, enabling me to create distinct sections for each portfolio type. To add some flair to my website, I turned to Framer Motion. This animation library allowed me to craft seamless transitions, hover effects, and page-scroll animations. Additionally, I integrated Full Page JS to introduce an intuitive navigation system, enabling users to effortlessly explore various portfolio types. With its smooth scrolling and full-screen sections, Full Page JS elevated the overall user experience. The goal is for this site to exemplify my skills as a Front-End Developer and I feel confident that it has done so.

projects.title: Observo
projects.desc: For my final year project in Creative Digital Media, I developed a React application that aimed to explore the correlation between habits and mood. This project served as my thesis for my undergraduate degree and was the most ambitious project I have worked on to date.  Leveraging the power of React, I crafted a user-friendly interface that allowed users to log in and seamlessly track their habits and mood over time. By integrating a Firebase backend, I ensured that user data was securely stored and easily accessible. The application enabled users to input their daily habits and record their mood, and then provided visualizations and analysis to showcase any potential connections between the two. This unique approach to understanding the impact of habits on mood resonated with both users and my academic evaluators. I am proud to share that my project received the highest grade in my graduating class. This recognition not only validated my hard work and dedication but also highlighted the potential of utilizing React and Firebase to develop insightful and impactful applications.

projects.title: Maths Masters
projects.desc: In my front-end development classes at CIT, I created an educational game called Maths Masters using Vanilla JS. This game, styled after the Pokemon franchise, aimed to make learning mathematics a fun and engaging experience for kids. Maths Masters featured four levels of increasing difficulty, each presenting a series of math problems to solve. To enhance the user experience, I incorporated animations and visually appealing graphics inspired by the Pokemon world. The game included a leaderboard feature to foster a sense of competition and allow players to compare their scores. I am proud to say that my lecturer graded Maths Masters with an impressive 94%.

projects.title: React To-Do App
projects.desc: I built a Weather App using React JS that utilizes an API call to retrieve real-time weather data. This app provided users with up-to-date weather information for any location they desired. By leveraging React JS, I created a dynamic and responsive user interface that allowed seamless interaction and data display. The API call enabled the app to fetch weather data, including temperature, humidity, wind speed, and conditions, providing users with accurate and relevant information. This project showcased my ability to integrate external data sources and deliver a functional and user-friendly application that enhanced the user's experience in staying informed about the weather.

title: Graphic Design
description: I have been programming for 10 years and teaching classes on the same topic for just as long. My expertise lies within Web Development though I know the fundamentals of Python. I am currently teaching myself React.JS, Node.JS and other associated topics.

projects.title: Motley Magazine
projects.desc: During my time as a Graphic and Print designer for a year of monthly magazine issues, I undertook a challenging role that required me to handle a multitude of responsibilities. As the designer, I was tasked with creating visually captivating layouts and graphics for each issue. Additionally, I played a crucial role in managing the production process, liaising with outside vendors to ensure the timely printing and distribution of the magazine. Being the go-to person for design requests across the campus, I adeptly handled various design projects, accommodating the needs and preferences of different departments. The successful publication of each magazine issue was a testament to my organizational skills, attention to detail, and ability to meet strict deadlines. By effectively balancing design work, communication with stakeholders, and vendor coordination, I contributed to the magazine's success in reaching the UCC campus and Cork City, leaving a lasting impact on readers through compelling visual content.

projects.title: Nimbus Research Centre
projects.desc: During my time as a UX design intern at the Nimbus Research Centre, I had the opportunity to work on a diverse range of projects and applications for our clients. From day one, I was immersed in a collaborative and innovative environment that encouraged experimentation and learning. I gained hands-on experience in conducting user research, creating wireframes and prototypes, and iterating designs based on user feedback. The supportive team at Nimbus provided invaluable guidance and mentorship, helping me develop my skills and deepen my understanding of user-centered design principles. It was a rewarding and fulfilling experience that solidified my passion for UX design.

projects.title: DePuy Synthes
projects.desc: Acted as the sole in-house designer and video producer for the global DePuy Synthes company, under Johnson & Johnson global. This involved Web Design, Graphic Design, Video Editing & Motion Graphic Design for a global audience and writing a comprehensive, 60+ page “Communications Playbook” teaching future team members how to interact with all of our various technical systems. Key roles included being the creative director for the DPS STEM Academy's 'Mission To Mars' Summer Camp. This role involved designing all the assets for the camp, writing, designing, and editing a 4-episode mini-series to go along with the lessons, many of which I helped to plan and facilitate with the children myself

projects.title: Good Start Ambassador at CIT
projects.desc: Brought on as a Good Start Ambassador where my role is to welcome incoming students to CIT and make them feel welcome and ease their worries. While also helping provide design and video editing support for the Good Start team. This role involves a lot of teamwork and collaboration with other ambassadors and the Good Start team. I have also been tasked with creating a series of videos to help incoming students get to know the campus and Cork city. This role has helped me to develop my teamwork and communication skills, as well as my ability to work under pressure and meet deadlines.
